column5: Ha ha..  that there's funny!  Good look.   All I have to say is...  HOLY!    Awesome fish guys..  which lure of yours were you using?
Wow, well done Clive!
Good job boys! Very impressive fish! Clive, caught on orange or black or orange and black? That musta felt good getting a monster on one of your own lures! -Brian
Caught on lures with no feathers Brian, but when I use the feathered lures orange has been more effective then black.
Caught on lures with no feathers Brian, but when I use the feathered lures orange has been more effective then black.
Holy smokies those are some nice pike!!   Bly
Thanks for posting the silver pike photo Clive.  What an unusual little guy.  That lure's almost half its size! LOL
zoinks, don't go in the water!  Those are some serious fish.  Very nicely done.
damn those are MONSTERS wtg
Thats a nice couple of toothy critters you guys got, good job and thanks for sharing the pics.
Beatiful fish..that is all i have to say.thanks for sharing
That Silver Pike almost looks like a cross with a Walleye (Pickeral).  The rest look like huge fish.  Great job on the camera.
AWESOME PIKE...  ...WTG ,thanks for sharing    cheers
Great fish guys. How do you get internet connections ? We will be there next week
Well done, Team Fury....

We have a few more 40+ inchers to share once we get some rest.  Just finished the 22+ hour drive to Toronto, but i still need to get back to London.  John - There is a wireless connection. The range isnt great, we had no connection from our cabin - we went and sat outside near the main cabin and got a strong connection.  If you have no laptop, Brett has a computer in the main cabin aswell.
Sweet pics Clive. Wish I had the time to head up that way looking for those green monsters.  Good shooting dude.
Great report and fish Clive. Thanks for the report and looking forward to the rest of the pics.
Unreal! Those are some huge PIGS, congrats on catching one with your own homemade lure.  Cheers, 1leg

The weather is cold, it has rained almsot everyday, but we still have been spending a lot of time on the water. I'll spare the rest of the details, but here are the pictures of our biggest fish so far!     This one was caught on my one of my very own lures!    I also caught asmall silver pike, its was pretty wild looking.
I didn't know johnny Depp enjoyed Pike fishin' in Canada?
WOW!!!!   those are some awesome pike.  good job.  jason
Well done Clive but at least Jon got to wear a t-shirt  Don't keep the neighbors up their kinda of grumpy   j/k  Whopper
Wow!
AWESOME boys!!!

Way to go - the Fishingfury team does it again - catching monster pike.  Missed your reports guys. Well done Clive and Jon.  Beautiful fish.  Any pics of what a 'silver' pike looks like?  Thanks for sharing.  Looking forward to your next report 007
Clive, Jon,  Those are bad. nasty, scary, PHAT, ESOXCULAR PIKEALICIOUS GRANDIFOLIAR SPECIMUNGUS HUMUNGUS CATCHALOPOGUSES!!  Sweet!
Only in my dreams !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Wow Wow Wow  One day.  MTP
Beauty pike, guys!  Mike
Waste my time with a bunch of little snot rockets...   ... JK - Awesome fish guys!!
We had one nice day!   I'll get that silver pike photo posted tonight. It is a silver blue colour and has no spots on it.
nice fish!
way to go team fury.  nice fish.
Some sweet fish there guys!  WTG!
Awesome as always gents, thanks for taking the time to post it while you're still there...  Maureen
The head on that first pike looks gargantuan compared to the rest of him.  Mutant Pike!!!  Nice fish, way to go  Joey
Great lookin spotted Tarpon Clive!!!! Sweet shots and lookin forward to more! HH
Sweet fish guys and that silver is cool too.
Seems quite a few folks visiting out there this spring.  Nice pikies fellas.
Great fish dude! I think I am more impressed with the silver pike....very cool!
Nice Fish!!!

I am particularly enjoying the fact that we're getting "live" reports, the only thing better would be a live feed from the boat as you're landing the fish, uploaded to satellite and then broadcast wide over OFC...    Mike
